bibl.title: Letter from Maria Teresa Rojas to Philip Showalter Hench, December 27, 1952

div1.p: Rojas requests that Hench send her some photographs of the Camp Lazear dedication. She also invites him to come to San Jose for a rest.

div1.head: Letter from Maria Teresa Rojas to Philip Showalter Hench, December 27, 1952
div1.opener:
Dec. 27, 1952
Dr. Philip S. Hench
102-110 Second Ave. Southwest
Rochester, Minn.
Dear Doctor:
div1.p:
I am writing to you in english
thinking if you can understand Dr. Nogueira's
letters you will understand mine too.

I am sending you the clippings of
the articles that appeared after you left. We
wanted to publish one of your pictures at the
ceremony at Camp Lazear with the article about
the Finca, but the photographer told us that
you had taken with you all of them, even the
films, and he had nothing left. As I could not
get anything from him, and Dr. Nogueira, who
promissed to send them to me, apparently has
forgotten, I will appreciate very much if you
could send me some copies sometime, because,
being as it was such “aa historical event”, I must
have them.

I think you can feel yourself satisfied
in spite of every thing, and I hope you are begin-
ning to plan something else to do al Camp Lazear,
But before that you have to come down to San José
(de incógnito) for a few days and have a good rest.

Wishing you and the rest of the family
every good wish for the New Year, I remain
